content.context: 今天是平安夜
As the first speaker, I don't have much information, except that the Witch saved someone last night. I don't want to reveal my identity, so werewolves, come and try to figure out who I am!

Player 1 is a villager. This is a good witch who serves the country and the people. Although we don't know if the saved player is a werewolf who killed themselves, at least by saving them, it shows that the witch hasn't given up on our good team. As a member of the good team, I sincerely thank the witch for her tireless efforts. Player 9's identity cannot be defined. I hope the seer speaks well and we listen to the seer's verification report.

I am a good character card, existing in a "superposition" of villager, witch, and hunter. If someone later declares me as a bad identity, then I'm a special role card. If no one mentions me later, I will "collapse" into a specific role at the end of the game. I think player 9's reluctance to reveal their identity suggests they are a good character who isn't afraid of being lynched. Player 1's gratitude towards the witch doesn't seem like werewolf behavior. Given that I'm certain I'm a good character, I believe there should be a high probability of werewolves among the players speaking after me.

Number 3 is a villager. Number 2 believes there are multiple werewolves in the later positions. Can I assume that Number 2 has implicitly accepted that Numbers 9 and 1, who have already spoken, are good? Number 2 thinks Number 9 is good because they don't want to reveal their identity, and Number 1 is good because they expressed gratitude to the witch. I find Number 2's logic for accepting Numbers 9 and 1 as good to be quite weak. If I, Number 3, don't reveal my identity and also express gratitude to the witch, would Number 2 consider me good as well? I think Number 9's speech suggests they are either a werewolf or a hunter, Number 1 seems like a passive villager or a passive werewolf, and Number 2 could be either a villager or a werewolf. I hope the seer in the later positions will speak thoughtfully and convince me with logic. I will choose my stance based on their speech and reasoning.

I am a villager. I believe there is a werewolf disguised as a villager among players 1 and 3. I won't comment much on the speeches of the players who spoke before me, because currently no one has claimed to be the seer. As a villager without night actions, my primary goal this round is to analyze the true and false seers. The identities of other players in later speaking positions can be further judged based on the voting in this round. I believe that voting, rather than speaking, best reflects whether someone is a good person or a werewolf. Now, I invite the seer in the later speaking positions to begin your brilliant performance!

Good morning everyone. I am the Seer, and I have identified player 4 as a bad identity. I checked player 4 to clarify their role. Player 4, being a werewolf, didn't pretend to be a Seer, so I believe one of their werewolf teammates will later pretend to be a Seer to save player 4. Last night was peaceful. If there's a Witch among us, please come forward and reveal your saved player to give the good team more information.

Player 4, a werewolf, said they "think there's a werewolf disguised as a villager among players 1 and 3." I believe player 4 is trying to put players 1 and 3 in a position to be voted out, or hoping the Witch might use the poison on player 1 or 3. I think players 1, 3, and 4 are not adjacent, so I believe players 1 and 3 are likely good.

Player 9 didn't reveal their identity, but as the first speaker, they might be pretending to be the Hunter to protect the real Hunter. I think player 9 is probably good. Player 2 directly acknowledged players 1 and 9 as good and hinted at having a special role. I think player 2 is likely a werewolf with information.

Tonight, I will check player 2's identity. I suggest all good players vote to eliminate player 4.

I am the Witch. Last night, the werewolves killed player 4, and I used my healing potion to save them. However, I suspect I might have saved a werewolf who intentionally killed themselves. Among the players who spoke before me, player 1 sounds like a good person. Player 1's interaction with the Witch seemed quite sincere, and I don't think a werewolf would act like that. The player who sounds most like a werewolf is my silver water, player 4. Player 4 thinks there's a werewolf among players 1 and 3, but doesn't provide any reasons. Looking at player 4's speech, there's no logical output at all, it's absolutely ridiculous! Moreover, player 4 didn't comment on players 9 and 2. I think player 4 might be a werewolf who killed themselves to deceive us. Although I saved player 4, I'm not going to protect them at all. I think player 5's speech logic is fine. Before player 5 spoke, I already suspected player 4 was a werewolf, and now player 5 has identified player 4 as a bad identity. So for now, I'm siding with player 5. Tonight, the werewolves will definitely try to kill me, so I must use my poison. Players 7 and 8, who are speaking after me, it's time for you to start your performance!

At this point in the turn order, no one has challenged the Seer role, so Player 5 is the uncontested Seer. Today, all good players should vote to eliminate Player 4. I can't determine the identities of Players 1 and 9 in the earlier positions, so I suggest that Seer 5 check either Player 1 or 9 tonight. I believe Player 2 is the most likely werewolf in the game. Player 2 was quick to accept Players 1 and 9 as good based on their brief statements. As a villager without night actions, shouldn't they maintain some suspicion towards players claiming to be villagers? After all, werewolves rarely claim special roles and can only pretend to be villagers to hide their identity. So I think Player 2 lacks critical thinking and might be a werewolf. Player 3 attacked Player 2, which aligns with my thoughts, so Player 3 might be good. I believe Player 6 is the Witch, as there's no need for a werewolf to claim the Witch role in a later position. Player 5 is the uncontested Seer, so today all good players should vote to eliminate Player 4.

I am the Seer, and I have verified that Player 9 has a good identity. Let me share a tip for choosing sides: If Player 5 is the Seer, then Players 4 and 8 would be the two werewolves. We don't need to worry about who the third werewolf is right now. Even if there are only two werewolves in this game, Player 4 should pretend to be the Seer rather than Player 8 in the last position. This is because when Player 4 speaks, the real Seer hasn't claimed their role yet, making Player 4's pretense more convincing and beneficial than if Player 8 were to do so. Therefore, Players 4 and 8 can't both be werewolves, which means Player 5 is the werewolf pretending to be the Seer, and I, Player 8, am the real Seer.

Now that I've shared this strategy, let me analyze the potential werewolves. Player 5 believes Players 9 and 1 are good, and Player 2 agrees. So why does Player 5 consider Player 2 a "werewolf with information"? It seems Player 5 can make accusations, but Player 2 can't defend others? I believe Player 2 is not Player 5's teammate and is actually good.

Player 7 is clearly lying. How can they claim Player 5 is the only Seer when I haven't even spoken yet? Player 7 also attacked Player 2 for defending Players 1 and 9. But Player 7, your so-called only Seer also defended Players 1 and 9, so why is Player 2 suddenly "the most suspicious werewolf" in your eyes? You have ulterior motives, Player 7 must be a werewolf!

So now we've identified Players 5 and 7 as werewolves, Players 9 and 2 as good, and Player 6 as the Witch. Among Players 1, 3, and 4, there's still one werewolf. Given my current skill level, I can't determine which one it is now. So, give me a chance to investigate further tomorrow.

For this round, let's all vote for Player 5!

- **Player 8**: Pretends to be a seer, declares player 9 as a good identity. Player 8's logic in considering players 5 and 7 as werewolves aligns with my judgment. Player 8's logical output is well-reasoned and consistent with a seer's perspective.

Based on the above, I decide to vote for player 5.

Otherwise, it would be impossible to gain the trust of the good team. To prove my "Seer" identity to the good team and gain their trust, I must vote for my "bad identity" Player 4.

- Firstly, Player 4 believes that among Players 1 and 3, there's a werewolf pretending to be a villager. If Player 4 were a werewolf, they would definitely claim to be the seer instead of giving Player 5 the chance to do so. Based on this, I judge Player 4 to be a good role.

I am a villager. I believe the werewolves are players 3, 5, and 7. In the previous round, player 1 sided with player 5 who was pretending to be a seer, but this round player 1 claims to be the hunter and is planning to vote for player 3. I am the Witch. Last night, I used my poison to eliminate Player 7. Yesterday, even before Player 8 spoke, I felt something was off about Player 7 when they said, "At my position, no one has claimed to be the Seer, so Player 5 must be the unopposed Seer." I ask you, Player 7, did you forget that Player 8 hadn't spoken yet? Player 7's perspective was severely limited, almost making mistakes during their speech, and they even voted incorrectly. So, I'm sorry, but I had to use my poison on you last night! To be honest, before Player 8 spoke yesterday, I still believed Player 5 was the Seer. But Player 8's speech was simply flawless - perfect! Player 8 analyzed Player 5's slip-ups, and their logic instantly enlightened me, leading me straight to the true Seer! I can only say that yesterday, I accidentally played a "bait and switch" move. In my speech, I said I would side with Player 5, and unexpectedly, it "lured out" the stubborn werewolf Player 7. When Player 7 saw the Witch siding with their fellow werewolf, they were overjoyed and immediately went into reckless charge mode. To think they could tell me Player 5 was the unopposed Seer is truly mind-boggling! I believe Players 5 and 7 are both werewolves, with the last werewolf being either Player 1 or 3, and one good player who sided incorrectly. Today, let's first hear Player 8's identity check. Didn't you say you were going to check one of Players 1, 3, or 4? No matter who you checked, the werewolves' survival space is already very tight. Today, as long as we vote out a werewolf, we will likely win the game!

Last night, I checked player 1 based on the voting pattern, and player 1 is a werewolf. Since player 2 was killed during the night and didn't use their gun, and player 1 confidently pretended to be the hunter right after player 9's speech, I suspect that either player 9 is the hunter or player 7, who was poisoned last night, is the hunter. Actually, after yesterday's voting pattern emerged, I've been curious about why players 1 and 3 could both vote for me. Combined with player 3's provocative speech today, I even suspect that player 7 might be a good person who was poisoned. Could player 3 also be a werewolf? Regarding player 4's identity, due to their brief speech, player 8 can't consider them as good. Lastly, player 3 thinks that if player 8 is the seer, then players 2 or 7 shouldn't have been killed. However, I believe that with one werewolf (player 5) already eliminated, the werewolves can kill anyone they want, as there are still 3 special roles and 3 villagers left. But if the eliminated player 5 was the seer, wouldn't player 8, as a werewolf, definitely kill player 6 (the witch) or try to kill the hunter? Would they allow player 1 to pretend to be the hunter on the field? It's precisely because player 8 is the seer that we can explain why players 2 and 7 were eliminated. I hope if player 3 is good, they'll listen to my heartfelt advice and vote for player 1 with me. If they still don't listen, I can only vote for player 3 tomorrow to honor player 7's departed soul!
